alert.note: Alert for Sherman; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 7:47PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Wallace and southern Sherman Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 646 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles south of Ruleton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph, pea size hail and torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Wallace and southern Sherman Counties, including the following locations... Edson. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 6 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northwestern and west central Kansas.
